string-array.name: cardDesc
string-array.item: A refugee from the Hell Dimensions and a companion demon to Hana, Akma serves as a recruiter for the Dragon.
Some say life and death are bitches, and there are those in the Illuminati who say she\'s got them both beat.
Regal and eloquent, he is the new face of the lions of the Secret World.
A sleepy New England town. Most of the residents are no longer alive, but they are all walking.
The air is as dry as a mummy\'s whispered lie. Aten cultists chant in the sandy ruins, worshiping the sun that kills with its stare.
A Transylvanian farmland where ghouls give cadavers their razor-toothed kisses and monsters are ground into sausage in a blood-stained barn.
There is a comfort in defying the rising tide of darkness with controlled bursts of high velocity artillery.
Anima and concentration attain a razor sharp level of focus when channeled through a blade.
Blood greases the gears that make the supernal world turn — a primordial power both sacred and profane.
Walk between raindrops. See the punchlines to the jokes the universe tells itself in fractal patterns and jagged chance. Harness chaos.
Breath storms. Shout lightning. Sing fire. Whisper ice. Bend gravity. The most basic and powerful laws of the universe thrum through one\'s fingers.
The weapon fits like a glove. Anima surges through the sharp points, unlocking something primal — hereditary memories of natural armaments. It feels… right.
The weight of the weapon feels good. And the repeating beat of hammer-smashing-monster-skulls sounds like laughter in the face of the apocalypse.
Two guns. Two hands. Anima bleeds into the chambers, awakening the bullets to magic.
Sometimes the only thing separating this world from the legion of unholy horrors is a spray of hot metal and a deafening boom.
